name: Rock & Roll
description: Developed in the United States and popularized in the 1950s, featuring prominent Blues scales, poppy structures, and strong rhythms.

children.name: Indorock
children.description: Predominantly instrumental style influenced by Country, Malay Music, and Hawaiian Music; created in the late 1950s by Indo and Moluccan expatriates from Indonesia to the Netherlands.

children.name: Rockabilly
children.description: Blends the sound of Country with that of Rhythm & Blues, often accompanied by driving guitars, frantic vocals, and slap-back echo in the bass.

children.name: Twist
children.description: Simple, fast, and energetic dance popular in the early 1960s.
